00087 
00088   /*
00089    * %Hyperspace session.  Provides the API for %Hyperspace, a namespace and
00090    * lock service.  This service is modeled after
00091    * <a href="http://labs.google.com/papers/chubby.html">Chubby</a>.
00092    * Presently it is implemented as just a single server, but ultimately
00093    * it will get re-written using a distributed consensus protocol for high
00094    * availablility.  For now, it provides the same functionality (albeit less
00095    * available) and the same API.
00096    * This allows us to get the system up and running and since the API is the
00097    * same as the API for the highly-available version, minimal code changes
00098    * will be needed when we swap out this one for the highly available one.
00099    * <p>
00100    * %Session establishes a session with the master which includes a TCP
00101    * connection and the initiation of regular heartbeat UDP messages.  As soon
00102    * as the master receives the first heartbeat message from the client
00103    * %Session object, it creates the session and grants a lease. Each heartbeat
00104    * that the master receives from the client causes the master to extend the
00105    * lease.  In this mode of operation, the session is in the SAFE state.  If
00106    * the master does not receive a heartbeat message before the lease
00107    * expiration time, then the session transitions to the EXPIRED state and
00108    * the master drops the session.
00109    * <p>
00110    * Whenever the client receives a heartbeat UDP response message, it advances
00111    * its conservative estimate of what it thinks the lease expiration time is.
00112    * If the lease expires, then the client will put the session in the JEOPARDY
00113    * state and will continue sending heartbeats for a period of time known as
00114    * the 'grace period'. During the JEOPARDY state, all %Hyperspace commands
00115    * are suspended.  If a heartbeat response message is received during the
00116    * grace period, then it will switch back to SAFE mode and allow pending
00117    * commands to proceed.  Otherwise, the session expires.
00118    * <p>
00119    * The following set of properties are available to configure the protocol
00120    * (default values are shown):
00121    * <pre>
00122    * Hyperspace.Lease.Interval=2000
00123    * Hyperspace.KeepAlive.Interval=1000
00124    * Hyperspace.GracePeriod=6000
00125    * </pre>
00126    */
00127   class Session : public ReferenceCount {
00128 
00129   public:
00130 
00134     enum State {
00136       STATE_EXPIRED,
00138       STATE_JEOPARDY,
00140       STATE_SAFE
00141     };
